sub_topic: Determining the girth of a graph.
message_1: Suppose we have a graph with 10 vertices and 15 edges. Determine the girth of the graph.
message_2:
The girth of a graph is the length of the shortest cycle in the graph. To determine the girth of the graph, we can use the following inequality:

girth ≤ 2 * (number of edges) / (number of vertices)

In this case, we have 10 vertices and 15 edges, so the inequality becomes:

girth ≤ 2 * 15 / 10
girth ≤ 3

Since the girth must be an integer value and the smallest cycle in a graph has a length of 3 (a triangle), the girth of the graph is 3.
